title: Parametric study of predictor accuracy impact on OFT rendezvous targeting
abstract: A parametric study was made to quantitatively define the effects of errors in the state vector predictor used by the Operational Flight Trainer (OFT) rendezvous targeting algorithms. The effect of the predictor accuracy on the OFT rendezvous profile is shown by the sensitivity of various critical rendezvous parameters with respect to downrange and radial predictor error rates. The effect of both inertial (same errors on both vehicles) and relative (differential errors on one vehicle with respect to the other) errors were considered. Relative radial error rates had the largest impact on the rendezvous followed by relative downrange errors, radial inertial errors and downrange inertial errors.
